name: anaphorically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that refers to or replaces a word used earlier in a text: "They" is normally used anaphorically; that is to say, it usually refers to something earlier in the discourse. Compare
cataphorically
More examplesFewer examplesThe third-person pronouns are anaphorically linked to their antecedents.In many of these examples from French, the word "ça" is used both anaphorically and cataphorically.The quantifiers are linked to the phrases they anaphorically refer to.Pronouns can be used anaphorically and demonstratives can be used in a non-demonstrative way.
